FacilityName: City of Winfield Water Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of the Winfield Water Treatment Plant are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of chlorine.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department. Cowley LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of drinking water to the community.  Chlorine is stored in tanks designed for that purpose.

3.  Accidental Release Prevention Program.  The City of Winfield abidies by all pertinent EPA RMP regulations to guard against accidental releases of chlorine at the water treatment plant, and if they do occur, to minimize their harm to the surrounding community and environment.

4.  Five-Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releaes of chlorine during the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting on off-site deaths, injuries, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.  Emergency Response Program.  The facility has a written emergency action plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a large release of chlorine takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all appliabale emergency response number listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  This facility is currently undergoing a major upgrade in all equipment.  Upon completion of this upgrade, Safety Information, Hazard Review, Operating Procedure, Training, and Maintenance Procedures will be written to conform with the new equipment.
